author: Staff Reporter
text:
In what could bring relief to small-time drama artistes across the State, the Chief Electoral Officer of Tamil Nadu has asked District Election Officers in Tamil Nadu to allow staging plays during the next few months.

The South India Artists Association or Nadigar Sangam had written to CEO Rajesh Lakhoni, asking for permission to stage plays from March to June.

“Since there had been a ban on them during the last general elections, the earnings of many who depend on this for their livelihood were affected," their letter had said.

‘Nod based on merit’

Election officer Rajesh Lakhoni directed the District Election Officers to give permission based on merit. The Media Certification and Monitoring Committee certificate can be obtained at the district level if the drama is political in nature.

A majority of members in Nadigar Sangam are drama artistes.

Film actor and theatre artiste Pasupathi said theatre artistes requested the Nadigar Sangam to help them stage plays without any interference because of the elections.

“The elections are at a time when smaller theatre groups that conduct street plays are at a disadvantage as they are sometimes stopped by the authorities. The reason is that the art forms such as Theru Koothu are performed at night. Since April-May are the busy months in their calendar, they requested us to explain it to the Election Officer. The officer has also said that plays can be conducted without any issue as long as they do not contain any party propaganda,” he said.
title: EC allows theatre plays
